data.title: AultCare QuickConnect June Luncheon
data.meta_description: Join us for the next AultCare QuickConnect Luncheon featuring Elaine Russell Reolfi who serves as Chief Executive Officer of CommQuest Services.Gain valuable insights as Elaine shares more about one of the largest nonprofit mental health and social services organizations in Northeast Ohio.Don...
data.text:
Description

Join us for the next AultCare QuickConnect Luncheon featuring Elaine Russell Reolfi who serves as Chief Executive Officer of CommQuest Services.

Gain valuable insights as Elaine shares more about one of the largest nonprofit mental health and social services organizations in Northeast Ohio.

Don't miss this opportunity to connect, learn, and be inspired!

Featured entree: Chicken Parmesan with penne pasta and a side salad.

About the series: AultCare QuickConnect offers great networking opportunities for business leads. Join Stark County's premier networking series – enjoy activities, hear speakers, make connections, and savor a delicious meal. Members can promote their business with a 30-second commercial by contributing a $15+ door prize. Contact Ashley to secure your spot.

BIO:Elaine Russell Reolfi

Elaine M. Russell Reolfi serves as chief executive officer of CommQuest Services. The organization is one of the largest nonprofit mental health and social services organizations in Northeast Ohio. The 350 professionals at CommQuest share a mission to help people survive and live their best lives through three pillars of care: mental health, addiction recovery, and social support services.

Prior to her current position, Elaine was executive vice president for human resources and corporate relations at TimkenSteel Corporation and president of the TimkenSteel Charitable Fund. She led human resources, industrial relations, total rewards, health and safety, investor relations, communications, and community relations. She was responsible for organizational design and the hiring, development, compensation, and engagement of highly skilled individuals at TimkenSteel, as well as relationships with stakeholders outside the company.

Elaine began her career in the automotive and health care industries before joining The Timken Company in 1995 to handle communications for its Asia Pacific and Latin American operations. She went on to lead various aspects of the company’s communications, brand management, and employee engagement activities. She joined TimkenSteel in 2014 to establish the brand for the new public company as well as create and lead the communications and community relations functions.

Elaine has served on many nonprofit boards related to health and education and currently serves on the boards of Stark State University where she is vice chair and the Sisters of Charity Foundation, where she is a member and former chair. She also held national leadership roles, serving as a council chair for the Manufacturers Alliance and as a member of the strategic communications council of the American Iron and Steel Institute.

Elaine has a bachelor’s degree in journalism and a master’s degree in business administration. She is also a graduate of the Executive Development for Global Excellence program at the University of Virginia Darden School of Business.

Please note: The Canton Regional Chamber does not support or endorse partisan political candidates and does not permit political campaigning or the display of campaign signs, clothing or other materials during out events and functions.
